data.message: What constitutes as bullying on facebook? One of my friends received a very nasty message to their inbox, without any cause or provocation. Already turned to that person with a few choice words of my own so they'd see how "nice" it feels and to leave my friend alone. At what point can we report someone for bullying?

replies.message: We're sorry to hear your friend is experiencing this, Anna-Maria. If you feel your friend is in immediate danger, please contact the local authorities. Depending on the seriousness of the situation, you can learn more about the tools Facebook offers to help you deal with bullying and harassment here: http://bit.ly/2ei35N6. You can also find more information, tools and resources on our Bullying Prevention Hub here: http://bit.ly/2etS72r. -Rhea
fb, see "messenger " . That have my questions.. Please help me

Tyrone Johnson If you use your eyes and read, it involved one of my friends. Excuse me for wanting to stand up for a friend. Any sane person would want bullying to have consequences, especially if the bully is a snotty obnoxious high schooler who has no clue about life, insulting someone who is already struggling in life. So yeah, your input isn't needed, to be honest.
Waktu kucung be nanna brrAaa Maria
